content:
I woke up to the sound of my breathing and the dropship engines. I slowly turned in bed to my right and saw the stars and the night of space outside. I turned back in bed and took comfort in knowing that I was okay. I clutched my blanket and pillow, feeling grateful for the safety and warmth they provided.

A few minutes later, Bellamy and Raven walked into the living quarters, and a few minutes after that, they came over to my room. Bellamy looked at me with a smile and asked, "How did you sleep?"

I was still groggy and responded, "I slept okay, but what time is it?"

Bellamy looked at his watch and said, "It's morning."

I nodded, feeling a sense of relief wash over me. I then asked, "Where's Clarke?"

Raven looked at me with a reassuring expression and said, "She's on the bridge, Madi. I'll take you to her."

I nodded, feeling grateful for Raven's help. I slowly got out of bed, my body still weak and aching. Raven helped me walk to the bridge, where Clarke was.

Clarke looked at me with a smile and said, "Welcome back, Madi. How did you sleep?"

I smiled back at her and said, "I slept okay, but I'm still a little weak."

Clarke nodded and said, "That's normal, Madi. You've been asleep for 20 years, your body needs to adjust."

I nodded, feeling grateful for Clarke's understanding. I looked out the window and saw the stars and the night of space outside. I knew that it would be a long journey ahead, but with Clarke, Bellamy, Raven and the rest of our new family, I knew that we would make it through.

The end.
